page.title: 18Cropwell Bishop,Vicarage Pt2
page.content: The old vicarage was on the corner of Stockwell Lane and the new vicarage was on Dobbin Close. {The New Vicarage. The new vicarage was a fine house. The out buildings including a fuel house and a wash room which had a stone sink and an iron pump.Up on Fern Hill there was a well which pumped water to the new vicarage.There was a high wall behind the vicarage part of which still remains, and Dobbin Close still has many of the original trees. In{1973}this vicarage was demolished and 5 houses were built on the site.It was then renamed{Dobbin Close}after the Rev.C.Dobbin.In 1983 the Southwell Diocese closed down the Tythby vicarage and bought{No.2 Dobbin Close. Thus the vicarage has returned to its former site and houses the present vicar the{Rev.Colin Perkins.
